top_comments.comment: Visit https://simplisafe.com/modustrial to learn more and to get at least 30% off your SimpliSafe security system!

comments_since_last_sample.body: I think it’s more modern to do push draws

Why don’t you go with a microwave/ oven combo like the Europeans do, saves space in the island for something else and keeps the look clean. Push to open hardware will save your clothing and sides from getting snagged but the matte hardware looks nice.
I rented an Airbnb with push doors and I swore I'd never get them in my house. It's fun at the start but get really frustrating to keep opening and closing drawers. Simple pull all day!

Man, what's the word for it, "envious"? You are so lucky to have all this space, and all those speciality tools! But hey, you worked pretty hard to be where you are at right now! 
So very cool to watch this whole series, keep the vids coming!
Push to open would be my choice
incredible video! you always deliver, cant wait for the next. loving this project mate.
Been waiting for this! Go the black pulls would be my recommendation.
Not everything can or should be push to open so use a combination of both
do the push and the small invisible pulls for backup
I think both would be better
I think both would be better

NOT "Push to open", it ALWAYS has finger marks and prints where you push. Clean it now. Next person opening a cabinet = marks AGAIN. Our hands and fingers leaves marks wherever we go due to natural body secretions sweat/oils. Go for "Pulls", you will regret push to open once you see all the marks when shooting a video, and they will definitely show up on video.

The design looks real spiffy though! 
Thumbs up from Sunny South Africa!! Love Karma, he needs to feature more!!!!
Do both on the long run it's better
i love following your journey and seeing your craftsmanship brother
What program are you using to make these models?
Bevel the tops of the doors for a recessed finger pull.
you are living the dream sir, and therefore you are my hero. Thank you for these videos.
